subject: Home & DIY
title: The Chest Was the First Furniture
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Chest Was the First Furniture.

hook.text: Before closets, dressers, or shelves existed, one piece of furniture did everything: the chest.

buildup.text: Medieval households stored clothes, valuables, documents, and tools in wooden chests. They doubled as seats and tables.

discovery.text: Traveling families carried their chests along. The word 'trousseau' comes from the trunk a bride brought to marriage.

twist.text: Adding a drawer to the bottom of a chest around the 1500s created the first 'chest of drawers'â€”the dresser was born.

climax.text: From one simple box came wardrobes, sideboards, desks, and cabinetsâ€”all evolved from the humble medieval chest.

punchline.text: Every piece of storage furniture started as a box.

quiz.question: How did the chest of drawers originate?
options: By adding a drawer to the bottom of a traditional chest
By stacking multiple chests on top of each other
A French cabinet maker invented it from scratch
